item.description:
Wear red or Pink if you like!

Values: To be nice, kind, cheerful, friendly and to be respectful to everyone. We utilize private dance parties as a vehicle to meet other singles. Purpose is to socialize with similar people of our age (40-65) who are searching for a lifetime partner. Have fun meeting old and new friends. Circulate, talk to everyone. If someone is alone go up to them and say hi! Please be Friendly, Positive, and optimistic to everyone.

This is a Yes Dance - I ask you to be respectful and say yes to anyone who asks you to dance once. Please understand this is our number one value. If you are able to say yes, then this is a great event for you to attend.

Please invite other friends, particularly men. Our personal goal is to have an equal amount of men and women. We are very close on equal numbers of men and women.

The synergistic efforts of everyone will make it truly a memorable dance party.

***The entry fee is $12.00 plus wine or food assignment listed below.
Of course if you are unable to bring anything, then your entry fee will be $30.00.

Organizer/Host - Richard Tosti

Format:
Location is in a warm, loving and relaxing environment.
"Dress code - "business casual" – NO JEANS OR SNEAKERS
7:00pm - 11:00pm
Saturday, Feb. 14th, 2009
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA
Maximum attendees 200
Dancing will be available - DJ

Appetizers served immediately
Buffet which will start at 7:45
Open Bar - wine/beer that you are assigned to bring

PLEASE BRING IN DISPOSABLE CONTAINERS

Women please bring the following: First letter of last name begins with:

A-T Wine or beer
· Chardonnay
· White Zinfandel
· Pinot Grigio
· Sauvignon Blanc
· Riesling
· Cabernet Sauvignon
· Pinot Noir
· Merlot
· Shiraz

S-Z 2 bottles soda (1 diet & 1 regular) and 2 gallons of water

Men please bring the following: First letter of last name begins with:

Label your food
A-L Healthy entrée - vegetable lasagna, pasta with broccoli and other vegetables, vegetable and cheese calzone, red sauce with pasta and cheese, cheese pizza, cheese and broccoli calzones-you can bring meat, but don't mix it with dairy products.
M-P Dessert – cookies, pie, brownies, fruit or cake
Q-R Italian bread and margarine –
S-T Cheese and crackers
U-Z tossed salad or vegetable tray with dip (make sure to include dressing)

Coffee and tea will be served

Please NO CHIPS

No shellfish or pork products

200 guests only

Location and Directions
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

128 North
Exit 32B Middlesex Turnpike (Burlington/Arlington)
At the end of the ramp turn right onto Middlesex Turnpike - on the left is Barnes/Noble
After the Burlington Mall turn right on to Burlington Mall Rd. - on left is Longs Jewelers
Take left after you pass Kohl’s on your left which is Lexington Street
Temple Shalom Emeth is on your left at16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

There are two parking lots on the right side of building. Fill in back lot first. Enter through the side entrance at the end of the building. Third parking lot is across the street - McGinnis Ave., - Mt Hope Church. Additional 100 plus cars.

You know the time, the location and what you should bring so let’s have fun!
See you on Saturday, Feb. 14th at 7:00pm----5:30pm for Arthur Murray Studios lesson:Tango
6:30 Free lesson Arthur Murray-with Larry-Cha Cha

The best is yet to be!
Richard Tosti
item.name: Valentine Dinner Singles Party 40-65
